result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha R. Schaper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: FTE/schooling/treatment of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescribed medications taken as prescribed. 

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Assessment, treatment, counseling per agent. 

DNA sample. 

No objection to transfer probation to Lincoln County. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rules violations

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha R. Schaper

records.addlTxt: re Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum re the 10.10.22 Sentencing Hearing
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:49 pm 
INCLUDES 21CF707, 21CF770, & 22CF457. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Julianne Lennon.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
In 21CF770: Cts. 1-3>>D&RI. 
In 22CF457: Cts. 1-4>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 21CF707: Ct. 1 (Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 22CF457: Ct. 5 (Possession of THC)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 6 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty in 21CF457 and defers entry of judgment in 22CF457. 
COURT accepts agreement of the parties. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 21CF707: Ct. 1>>DEOJ for 2 yrs with conditions as outlined in written agreement - if def successfully completes terms of agreement, charge to be amended to Misd. Theft pursuant with sentence of $5 plus costs. Def is entitled to 168 days credit. 
In 22CF457: Cts. 5 & 6>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescribed medications taken as prescribed; no possession of drug paraphernalia; 60 days MCJ imposed and STAYED for rule violations; assessment/treatment/counseling per agent; fulltime employment/school/treatment of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; DNA sample/surcharge; CC; Restitution if requested in statutory time frame plus 10% surcharge. Def is entitled to 134 days credit. 
COURT has no objection to transfer of probation to Lincoln County. 

State notes victim's rights are NOT complied with as victim in 21CF707 wished to make statement prior to sentencing and arrangements were not made by the DA's office for victim to appear today. 
COURT withholds entry of judgment of conviction pending victim input. 
COURT converts cash bond to signature bond. 
COURT directs parties to see JA to set sentencing hearing - victim and def may appear by Zoom. 

Adj: 4:09 pm

Clerk Amends Minutes on 9/1/2022 at 9:18 am.

AMENDED: Includes cases 21CF707, 21CF770, & 22CF457. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

AMENDED: Includes cases 21CF707, 21CF770, & 22CF457. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk Amy. 
Case Called: 2:43 p.m. 
INCLUDES 21CF707, 21CF770, & 22CF457.   
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Julianne Lennon. 

Date and time set for motion to modify bond on all files; VRCW.
ADA Coonen objects to motion. 
Atty Lennon makes arguments re: bond modification. 

COURT makes findings and reduces cash component of bond to $1500.00; all conditions remain the same.  

Atty Lennon states there is no agreement on all matters at this point; requesting another hearing in Court. 
ADA Coonen has no objection. 

COURT sets PTC for 7/19/22 at 2:00 p.m. 

Adj:  2:50 p.m.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail
